body.p: This chapter demonstrates the usage of figures.

Using an SVG as figure.
SVGs - as these are XML files - can use placeholders as well. This way context specific replacements can be performed. In addition, this approach represents an option combine a custom layout with content without the need to write XSLT.
SVGs can be scaled as required. Giving best results with any print output.

Using an PNG as figure.
Non-scalable image formats have a defined resolution. On screen the resolution may still be sufficient (72dpi), but when zooming into or when printing low resolution pictures show artifacts.
The features of SVG are striking in combination with the toolkit. In particular, arbitrary content can be placed as SVG figure. Transparency and alignments are working out great.
